definition: A memory-related process in which the accessibility, strength, or detail of stored MentalRepresentations decreases over time, leading to partial or complete forgetting.

positive_examples: He can no longer recall the details of the meeting from last year.
The system’s older logs are gradually downsampled, losing fine-grained information.
She remembers that something happened, but not where or when.
negative_examples: He instantly recalls a vivid scene from childhood.
The agent’s knowledge base never deletes or fades any entries.
She deliberately suppresses a thought to avoid thinking about it (motivated forgetting).
training_hints.disambiguation: Not intentional suppression or policy-based deletion; specifically passive degradation of memory strength or accessibility over time.
